item.title: Coronavirus: Deaths at 20-year high but peak may be over
item.description: Numbers dying nearly double above what would be expected, but peak may now be over, say experts.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I didn't think I was going to get home'
item.description: Paramedic Mark Anders was infected with Covid-19 but is now out of hospital and recovering.

item.title: Coronavirus: Cheshire businessman's anger as PPE offer 'ignored'
item.description: Paul Dodd says he has offered to produce 450 visors a day for the NHS but heard nothing.

item.title: Coronavirus: Capt Tom Moore opens Harrogate NHS Nightingale hospital
item.description: A virtual ceremony was held to officially open the NHS Nightingale Hospital Yorkshire and The Humber.

item.title: The tiny premature baby who fought off coronavirus
item.description: Peyton Maguire from Lanarkshire is one of the youngest Covid-19 patients in the UK.

item.title: Coronavirus: Boris Johnson to speak to the Queen and Trump
item.description: The prime minister is also expected to have a phone conversation with the Queen in the coming days.

item.title: Coronavirus: Insurer to give £25 refunds as cars and vans sit idle
item.description: Pressure mounts on other motor insurers to offer refunds as people stay at home during the pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: Masks for public 'could put NHS supplies at risk'
item.description: The hospitals bosses' warning comes ahead of a review into whether people should be urged to wear them.

item.title: Kim Jong-un illness rumours denied amid intense speculation
item.description: South Korea says reports that Kim Jong-un is gravely ill are not true, after intense speculation.

item.title: Shropshire maternity care inquiry could include 1,200 cases
item.description: Families who wish to have their maternity care investigated urged to make contact by end of May.

item.title: Pescara football club adopts Italian boy's shirt design
item.description: A six-year-old wins a competition to design Pescara football club's shirt for next season.

item.title: Nintendo owners urged to secure accounts
item.description: Switch owners report an apparent surge in attempts to buy expensive items through Nintendo accounts.

item.title: War veteran Ken Benbow gets cushion picturing late wife Ada
item.description: Ken Benbow, 94, was given a cushion bearing a picture of his late wife of 71 years Ada.

item.title: Planned from scratch: Brasilia at 60 in pictures
item.description: The purpose-built Brazilian city celebrates 60 years since it became the country's capital.

item.title: WHO's Nabarro: We must learn to live with Covid-19
item.description: The coronavirus is not going to go away, says WHO's special envoy for Covid-19 David Nabarro.

item.title: Coronavirus dreams: Why are people having lockdown nightmares?
item.description: Some people are reporting more intense dreams while in lockdown due to coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: How the funeral industry is coping with Covid-19
item.description: A south-east London funeral directors say their workload has doubled since the outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: Children with autism allowed to play in Italian park
item.description: Italy has closed its parks during lockdown, but one is opening for children with autism.

item.title: Coronavirus: Damien Hirst’s rainbow giveaway
item.description: The artist is hoping to raise funds and spread joy with his latest artworks, created in response to the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Coronavirus: Rush for haircuts in Denmark as lockdown eases
item.description: Hairdressers and a range of other small businesses have reopened in Denmark.

item.title: Idris Elba 'humbled to be alive' after coronavirus
item.description: The actor says he's got a new outlook on life after recovery – and it's inspired him to help.

item.title: Coronavirus: Am I helping to protect the NHS?
item.description: The UK has introduced a number of social distancing measures to tackle the coronavirus pandemic. How effective are they?

item.title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: The patient who married hours before dying
item.description: Dr John Wright relates two love stories from the Covid wards of Bradford Royal Infirmary.

item.title: Coronavirus: Are hospital cleaners forgotten heroes in this crisis?
item.description: Hygiene has never seemed more important. Here's how a woman who cleans wards in Chicago is being affected.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why are international comparisons difficult?
item.description: Should you be comparing Covid-19 statistics between countries?

item.title: Afghanistan: The detention centre for teenage Taliban members
item.description: The Afghan detention centre houses some 300 boys under 18, of whom half are alleged to be militants.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why hanging on to a ticket could save your favourite festival
item.description: Some independent festivals are worried refunding after virus cancellation could end their business.

item.title: Coronavirus: How big is the problem in care homes?
item.description: What's the scale of coronavirus in the UK's care sector, and is it possible to get accurate figures?

item.title: Meghan and Harry: Will the real couple please stand up?
item.description: Our royal correspondent considers the latest moves by the Duke and Duchess of Sussex.

item.title: Coronavirus: Key workers are clapped and cheered, but what are they paid?
item.description: Every Thursday the country comes together to celebrate our key workers, but how well are they paid?

item.title: Coronavirus: Somali diaspora sends home stories of woe
item.description: British-Somalis have been badly hit in both economic and human terms.

item.title: Cartwheels, masks & going berserk - what are the Premier League's most iconic celebrations?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at 20 iconic Premier League celebrations - and you can choose your favourite at the bottom of the page.

item.title: Former UK Athletics performance director Black dies
item.description: Neil Black, the former performance director of UK Athletics, has died aged 60, the organisation confirms.

item.title: Manchester United beat Tottenham in 2018 FA Cup semi-final - Ander Herrera scores winner
item.description: Ander Herrera seals a comeback win for Manchester United against Tottenham in their 2018 FA Cup semi-final.

item.title: ECB to explore chairman-elect Watmore misconduct claim
item.description: The England and Wales Cricket Board will explore a claim that its chairman-elect Ian Watmore left his previous job following an allegation of misconduct.

item.title: Barcelona to give sponsor Nou Camp naming rights with revenue used to fight coronavirus
item.description: Barcelona are to give a sponsor naming rights to the Nou Camp for the first time and donate all the revenue to fighting coronavirus.

item.title: Ashleigh Gardner: Australia all-rounder on aboriginal roots
item.description: Australia all-rounder Ashleigh Gardner talks about her rare achievement - being an aboriginal Test cricketer.

item.title: Coronavirus: Testing and why it matters
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus and how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus: Should we all be wearing masks now?
item.description: There is growing discussion about the potential benefits of the general public wearing masks.

item.title: Coronavirus vaccine: When will we have one?
item.description: We answer some of the big questions about vaccines and how long one for coronavirus could take.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Everybody should be avoiding non-essential contact, and you should stay at home wherever possible.

item.title: Coronavirus: The world in lockdown in maps and charts
item.description: With more than a million coronavirus cases confirmed worldwide, an analysis of the world in lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: What do all the terms mean?
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak

item.title: What is the coronavirus?
item.description: Everything you need to know about the coronavirus – explained in just one minute.

item.title: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
item.description: What is it like to have the coronavirus, how will it affect you and how is it treated?

item.title: Coronavirus death rate: What are the chances of dying?
item.description: The current best guess of a 1% death rate does not apply to everyone.

item.title: Coronavirus: When will the outbreak end and life get back to normal?
item.description: The huge challenge the world faces to find an exit strategy to end the lockdowns and return to normal.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'How I'm coping with self-isolation'
item.description: With the impact that coronavirus is having on our daily lives, people are finding new ways to fill their free time.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I'm begging you, please be careful'
item.description: A woman being treated for coronavirus has made an appeal for people to stay home.

item.title: Coronavirus update: Why does staying at home help?
item.description: After Boris Johnson brings in new measures, the BBC explains why staying in is a matter of life and death.

item.title: Coronavirus: How to wash your hands - in 20 seconds
item.description: Dr Adele McCormick from the University of Westminster demonstrates how to wash your hands.

item.title: Coronavirus information: What should I do?
item.description: Step-by-step, what to do to help prevent the spread of the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson is among those to be treated in hospital for the symptoms of Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: More myths to ignore
item.description: Reality Check tackles misleading health advice being shared online.

item.title: The workers braving coronavirus
item.description: From supermarkets to warehouses to pharmacies, these are the people keeping things running.

item.title: The volunteer army helping self-isolating neighbours
item.description: The coronavirus outbreak has left many feeling trapped indoors, but for some help may not be far away.

item.title: Coronavirus: The rough sleepers who can't self-isolate
item.description: With soup kitchens closing and hostels 'like a Petri dish', homeless people are scared about the future.

item.title: Oklahoma City bombing: The day domestic terror shook America
item.description: Twenty-five years ago, on 19 April, a deadly bomb attack shook America and left 168 people dead.
